verses.text: How doth the city sit solitary,
She weepeth sore in the night,
Judah is gone into captivity because of affliction,
The ways of Zion do mourn,
Her adversaries are the chief,
And from the daughter of Zion
Jerusalem remembered
Jerusalem hath grievously sinned;
Her filthiness is in her skirts;
The adversary hath spread out his hand
All her people sigh,
Is it nothing to you,
From above hath he sent fire into my bones,
The yoke of my transgressions is bound
The Lord hath trodden under foot all my mighty men
For these things I weep;
Zion spreadeth forth her hands,
The LORD is righteous;
I called for my lovers,
Behold, O LORD ; for I am in distress:
They have heard that I sigh:
Let all their wickedness come before thee;
